verses.text: Now it came to pass, when Sanballat , and Tobiah , and Geshem the Arabian , and the rest of our enemies , heard that I had builded the wall , and \add that\add* there was no breach left therein; ( though at that time I had not set up the doors upon the gates ;)
That Sanballat and Geshem sent unto me, saying , Come , let us meet together in \add some one of\add* the villages in the plain of Ono. But they thought to do me mischief.
And I sent messengers unto them, saying , I \add am\add* doing a great work , so that I cannot come down : why should the work cease , whilst I leave it, and come down to you?
Yet they sent unto me four times after this sort ; and I answered them after the same manner.
Then sent Sanballat his servant unto me in like manner the fifth time with an open letter in his hand ;

Wherein \add was\add* written , It is reported among the heathen , and Gashmu saith \add it, that\add* thou and the Jews think to rebel : for which cause thou buildest the wall , that thou mayest be their king , according to these words.\f + \fr 6.6 \ft Gashmu: also called, Geshem\f*

And thou hast also appointed prophets to preach of thee at Jerusalem , saying , \add There is\add* a king in Judah : and now shall it be reported to the king according to these words. Come now therefore, and let us take counsel together.
Then I sent unto him, saying , There are no such things done as thou sayest , but thou feignest them out of thine own heart.
For they all made us afraid , saying , Their hands shall be weakened from the work , that it be not done. Now therefore, \add O God\add*, strengthen my hands. \p

Afterward I came unto the house of Shemaiah the son of Delaiah the son of Mehetabeel , who \add was\add* shut up ; and he said , Let us meet together in the house of God , within the temple , and let us shut the doors of the temple : for they will come to slay thee; yea, in the night will they come to slay thee.
And I said , Should such a man as I flee ? and who \add is there\add*, that, \add being\add* as I \add am\add*, would go into the temple to save his life ? I will not go in.
And, lo, I perceived that God had not sent him; but that he pronounced this prophecy against me: for Tobiah and Sanballat had hired him.
Therefore \add was\add* he hired , that I should be afraid , and do so , and sin , and \add that\add* they might have \add matter\add* for an evil report , that they might reproach me.
My God , think thou upon Tobiah and Sanballat according to these their works , and on the prophetess Noadiah , and the rest of the prophets , that would have put me in fear. \p
¶ So the wall was finished in the twenty and fifth \add day\add* of \add the month\add* Elul , in fifty and two days.

And it came to pass, that when all our enemies heard \add thereof\add*, and all the heathen that \add were\add* about us saw \add these things\add*, they were much cast down in their own eyes : for they perceived that this work was wrought of our God. \p

¶ Moreover in those days the nobles of Judah sent many letters unto Tobiah , and \add the letters\add* of Tobiah came unto them.\f + \fr 6.17 \ft sent…: Heb. multiplied their letters passing to Tobiah\f*

For \add there were\add* many in Judah sworn unto him, because he \add was\add* the son in law of Shechaniah the son of Arah ; and his son Johanan had taken the daughter of Meshullam the son of Berechiah.
Also they reported his good deeds before me, and uttered my words to him. \add And\add* Tobiah sent letters to put me in fear.\f + \fr 6.19 \ft words: or, matters\f*
